TextBody:
Hello,

Thanks for reaching out!

Tamper mode was designed in order to block the user to stop the services and by design can be disabled from the User Interface of Endpoint Protector only.

Please let me know the name of the customer so I can add it to the ticket.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

TextBody:
Hi Juan,

It can't be disabled in the registry, because this would mean that the purpose of this security feature would present a vulnerability.

Best regards,
Botond Biro | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption

Hello Soporte,

I wanted to check in regarding your support ticket 00440687. We haven’t heard from you in a while, and I just wanted to see if you still need assistance with this issue.

If you’re still experiencing problems or have any updates to share, please let me know. If the issue has been resolved, I can go ahead and close the ticket on my end.

Please feel free to reply to this email with any updates or questions. We’re here to help you get the most out of your Netwrix products.

Ticket Subject: Disable tamper protection
Ticket Details: Hello,
We have a question:
Can tamper protection be forcibly disabled from the windows registry?
Best regards.

Thank you!
